Package org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.alt

Class AltAutomaton

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractEditable
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.Automaton
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.alt.AbstractAltAutomaton
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.alt.AltAutomaton
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, Editable
public class AltAutomaton
extends AbstractAltAutomaton
An AltAutomaton is an alternating automaton which can be in DNF form or CNF form. To distinguish between existential states and universal states, we use AltState objects (alternating states) for existential states in DNF form and universal states in CNF form, while AltConnector (alternating connectors) objects are used for universal states in DNF form and existential states in CNF form. A transition cannot connect two universal states in DNF form, or two existential states in CNF form. A transition from an universal state to an existential state in DNF form (or from an existential state to an universal state in CNF form) cannot have any label.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai
See Also:
Serialized Form

    • reorder

      public void reorder()
      Description copied from class: Automaton
      Reorders the IDs of states. The ID of a state is given by its depth-first search number. The ID of the initial state will be 0.
